language_tests.title: Language Tests
language_tests.description: Complete guides for all English and French language tests accepted for Canadian immigration

guides.title: IELTS General Training
guides.subtitle: International English Language Testing System
guides.overview: IELTS General Training is the most widely accepted English language test for Canadian immigration. Required for Express Entry, PNPs, and citizenship applications.
tips: Practice with official IELTS materials from British Council or IDP
Focus on listening - you only hear recordings once
For writing, aim for clear structure: introduction, body paragraphs, conclusion
Speaking: Don't memorize answers - examiners can tell
Time management is crucial in Reading section
Take practice tests under real exam conditions
common_mistakes: Taking Academic instead of General Training
Not completing all sections of the answer sheet
Exceeding word limits in Writing tasks
Using informal language in formal writing tasks
Not leaving time to transfer answers

guides.title: CELPIP General
guides.subtitle: Canadian English Language Proficiency Index Program
guides.overview: CELPIP is designed specifically for Canadian immigration and citizenship. It's fully computer-based with Canadian accents and contexts.

key_facts.test_type: General (for PR) or General LS (for citizenship)

clb_conversion.info: CELPIP scores directly correspond to CLB levels (CELPIP 9 = CLB 9)

tips: Familiarize yourself with Canadian accents and expressions
Practice with CELPIP's free online resources
The speaking section is recorded - speak clearly into the microphone
Writing tasks have specific formats - learn them
Results come within 3-4 business days
You can retake after 4 days if needed
common_mistakes: Not practicing with computer-based format
Ignoring Canadian cultural references
Speaking too fast or too slow in Speaking section
Not using the full time for Writing tasks

guides.title: PTE Core
guides.subtitle: Pearson Test of English Core
guides.overview: PTE Core is the newest accepted English test for Canadian immigration. Fully computer-scored with fast results (48 hours).
tips: Computer scores everything - clarity matters more than accent
Speak at a natural pace, not too fast
Results in 48 hours - great for tight deadlines
Practice with AI scoring to understand the system

guides.title: TEF Canada
guides.subtitle: Test d'√©valuation de fran√ßais
guides.overview: TEF Canada tests French proficiency for Canadian immigration. French skills can add up to 50 bonus CRS points!

nclc_requirements.NCLC 7: Required for Express Entry with French as first language

tips: French proficiency can add 50+ CRS bonus points
Watch French Canadian media (Radio-Canada, TVA)
Practice with Quebec French expressions
Join French conversation groups

guides.title: TCF Canada
guides.subtitle: Test de connaissance du fran√ßais
guides.overview: TCF Canada is an alternative French test accepted for Canadian immigration. Administered by France √âducation International.

credential_evaluation.title: Credential Evaluation
credential_evaluation.description: How to get your foreign education recognized in Canada

guides.title: WES ECA
guides.subtitle: World Education Services - Educational Credential Assessment
guides.overview: WES is the most popular credential evaluation service for Canadian immigration. Required for Express Entry if you studied outside Canada.

step_by_step.title: Create WES Account
step_by_step.description: Go to wes.org/ca and create an account. Make sure you're on the CANADA site, not USA.

step_by_step.title: Select Evaluation Type
step_by_step.description: Choose 'ECA Application for IRCC' for immigration purposes.

step_by_step.title: Pay Fees
step_by_step.description: $256 CAD for evaluation + delivery fees. Standard delivery $13 CAD, Courier $28-95 CAD.

step_by_step.title: Get Reference Number
step_by_step.description: Write this number on ALL documents you send to WES.

step_by_step.title: Send Documents
step_by_step.description: Transcripts must be sent directly from your university to WES. Degree certificates can be uploaded.

step_by_step.title: Track & Receive
step_by_step.description: Monitor status online. Digital report sent to IRCC automatically.

documents_required: For India: Both bachelor's and master's degrees required
tips: Start early - allow 2+ months buffer
Use FedEx or UPS (DHL has issues in Canada)
Only submit your highest credential usually
For India, request sealed transcripts via DigiLocker
common_mistakes: Using WES USA site instead of WES Canada
Forgetting to include reference number on documents
Sending transcripts yourself instead of through institution
Waiting too long and missing Express Entry deadlines

express_entry.title: Express Entry
express_entry.description: Canada's flagship immigration system for skilled workers

guides.title: Express Entry Complete Guide
guides.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Canada's fastest PR pathway
guides.overview: Express Entry is Canada's points-based immigration system managing three federal programs. Most applicants get PR in 6 months or less!

programs.name: Canadian Experience Class (CEC)
requirements: CLB 7 for NOC TEER 0/1, CLB 5 for TEER 2/3
1+ year Canadian work experience in last 3 years
programs.best_for: Temporary workers and international students in Canada

improvement_strategies.details: Going from CLB 7 to CLB 9 can add 60 points. Retake IELTS/CELPIP!
NCLC 7 in French + CLB 5 in English = 50 bonus points. Plus access to French-focused draws with lower cutoffs.
PNP nomination virtually guarantees an ITA. Research all province programs.
Work in Canada on a work permit. Each year adds points.
A Canadian diploma or degree adds points plus unlocks PGWP.

atlantic_immigration.title: Atlantic Immigration Program
atlantic_immigration.description: Special program for Atlantic Canada's four provinces

guides.title: Atlantic Immigration Program (AIP)
guides.subtitle: Fast-track to PR in Atlantic Canada
guides.overview: The AIP is an employer-driven program for Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, PEI, and Newfoundland. No LMIA required!
requirements: 1,560 hours work experience in last 5 years
CLB 5 for TEER 0-3, CLB 4 for TEER 4

forms_guides.title: Form Filling Guides
forms_guides.description: Step-by-step guides for all IRCC immigration forms

guides.title: IMM 0008 - Generic Application Form
guides.subtitle: The main PR application form
guides.overview: IMM 0008 is the primary application form for Canadian permanent residence. It must generate barcodes when validated.
key_tips: Use Adobe Reader 10+ to open and fill
Include all family members even if not accompanying
common_mistakes: Missing barcode (form not validated)
Initials instead of full names
Inconsistent dates with other forms
Not listing all family members

guides.title: IMM 5669 - Schedule A Background Declaration
guides.subtitle: Personal history and background form
guides.overview: Schedule A declares your personal history including addresses, employment, education, and memberships.
key_tips: List ALL addresses for past 10 years
Include all employment with no gaps
common_mistakes: Gaps in timeline
Missing addresses
Forgetting volunteer organizations
Inconsistent dates with IMM 0008

guides.title: IMM 5406 - Additional Family Information
guides.subtitle: Detailed family member information
guides.overview: IMM 5406 requires detailed information about your family members including parents and siblings.
key_tips: Complete TWO copies: one for you, one for spouse
Names in native alphabet AND English
List current addresses for all relatives

meta.disclaimer: This information is for educational purposes only. Always verify with official IRCC sources.
